Release 0.4.23: Fix deprecation warning for Node v10 and typings

Change NodeBuffer back to Buffer

Replace NodeBuffer with Buffer in typings (#186)

NodeBuffer was removed a while ago.

Fix node encodings check Buffer() deprecation (#185)

This fixes a deprecation warning on Node v10 due to a call to
`new Buffer(0)` for node encoding feature detection.
Release 0.4.22: Fix support for NPM v1.x (used in Node v0.10)

Use older semver style for old Node.js 0.10 npm versions (#182)

* Use older semver style for old Node.js 0.10 npm versions
* Fix test for changes Node.js 10 behavior
Release 0.4.21: Minor fixes
Fix encoding canonicalization (fixes #156)

Remove Adoption section from readme

It's not relevant anymore.

Fix the paths in "browser" field in package.json

Those paths are relative to `package.json`, and the files are in the `lib` directory.
Release 0.4.20: Updated Buffer constructor usage to comply with Node v10 deprecations

Use Buffer.(from|alloc) instead of deprecated Buffer API

This also includes a dependnecy on a polyfill targeting older Node.js
versions where Buffer.alloc() and Buffer.from() API is not implemented
(Node.js < 4.5.0 and some 5.x versions).

Fixes: https://github.com/ashtuchkin/iconv-lite/issues/176

Ref: https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/19079
Ref: https://nodejs.org/api/deprecations.html#deprecations_dep0005_buffer_constructor
Ref: https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#buffer_class_buffer
Ref: https://github.com/ChALkeR/safer-buffer/blob/master/Porting-Buffer.md

Downgrade dev deps to fix build on older Node.js (#178)

This eliminates `const` usage which breaks on older Node.js versions
present in the test matrix.

Downgraded mocha to ^3 and request to ~2.81.

Release 0.4.17: Updated typescript type definition file

Fix Typescript type definitions to work with Angular 2's AoT compiler (#153)

So basically using MS' version of type definitions fixes a problem with Angular 2's AoT compiler.

This version has been tested with both the AoT compiler and the JiT compiler.

Seems to be no side effects.

The error was:
Error encountered resolving symbol values statically. Could not resolve stream relative to
            node_modules/iconv-lite/lib/index.d.ts., resolving symbol
            DecodeStream in node_modules/iconv-lite/lib/index.d.ts

Release 0.4.6: Minor fixes

Fix rarely-used encoding aliases

When searching the encoding, it's name is stripped of all non-alphanum
characters to adequately relax the search. For it to work, we pre-strip
encoding names/aliases of our supported encodings.

Fixes #86

Fix for 'windows-31j': remove hyphens from encoding id
remove рyphens from encoding id

Remove Node v0.11 from travis build.

Current version 0.11.13 has some speed regression, so tests fail with
timeout (see #65).
But! We cannot test with previous 0.11 versions either because node-iconv
uses 'nan' module which removed support for all but 0.11.13.
(see https://github.com/rvagg/nan#may-2014-major-changes-for-v8-325--node-01113)
Crazy, huh?

So, until either 0.11.14 or 0.12 released, I remove 0.11 version from travis checks.
Fix travis build by downgrading to 0.11.12

Merge pull request #23 from Niggler/master

Added new codepage aliases and new Mac Central Europe CP

Added MS Macintosh Code Page Support

Microsoft applications recognize the following code page numbers for Mac CPs:

10000   Macintosh Roman
10006   Macintosh Greek
10007   Macintosh Cyrillic
10029   Macintosh Central Europe <-- Added in this commit
10079   Macintosh Icelandic
10081   Macintosh Turkish

Note that the ICONV binary on OSX doesn't recognize these codes.

http://www.unicode.org/Public/MAPPINGS/VENDORS/APPLE/ has the relevant defs

The CENTEURO.TXT file was used to generate the missing Central Europe codepage
